children.subject: No, the 1 unit (3hrs/week) involves both bcourse section and teaching
To confirm, does this mean that being an AI will result in 2 units? (1 for the bcourse section and another for teaching?)
Hello, have CS 88 reader and tutor decisions been released yet? Thanks!
Hi, I know this is an old post but I was wondering if AI's had already been decided for Fall 2020 and if not where the application form is available. I could not find a post for that anywhere.

history.content:
Hello!

Hope you had a great winter break. We're looking for students who earned a B or higher in CS88 or CS61A, are passionate about the course, and have the potential to become tutors and UGSIs in future semesters.

Deadline for interest form: Tuesday, 1/28 at 11:59pm

First lab with Academic Interns: Monday 2/3

Academic Interns will work for 3 hrs/week per unit. The breakdown of the 3 hours consists of:

- 1 hour of meeting time with a UGSI
- 1 hours of assisting in lab
- 0.5 hour preparation time
- 0.5 hour for pedagogy practice/reflection a week (online in bCourses)

Please note that starting from Fall 2019, the EECS department is also requiring all academic interns to be enrolled in mandatory 1-unit bCourses online section (20-30 minute per week for reflections + pedagogy support).

3 hr/week translates to 1 P/NP teaching unit

Fill out a non-binding interest form here :) CS 88 AI Interest form

Join our Piazza @ piazza.com/berkeley/spring2020/cs88

If you have any questions, feel free to send them to Srinath Goli (srig@berkeley.edu)
history.subject: Join CS 88 Course Staff as an Academic Intern
